intro: Portesia diversifolia, commonly known as the diverse-leaved portesia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that vary in color and texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Portesia diversifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and swamps.
